ca.team3161.lib.robot

Class PIDDrivetrain

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.team3161.lib.robot.Subsystem
      • ca.team3161.lib.robot.PIDDrivetrain

  • public class PIDDrivetrain
extends Subsystem
    A Drivetrain controller that uses PID objects and is able to accurately drive straight and turn by degrees.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  PIDDrivetrain.DriveTask
      An action this PIDDrivetrain may carry out.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      PIDDrivetrain.DriveTask DRIVE
      The task defining the action of driving straight forward (or backward).
      PIDDrivetrain.DriveTask TURN
      The task defining the action of turning in place.

      • Fields inherited from class ca.team3161.lib.robot.Subsystem

        cancelled, repeating, resources, started, TASK_TIMEOUT, threadName

    • Constructor Detail

      • PIDDrivetrain

        public PIDDrivetrain(SpeedController leftDrive,
             SpeedController rightDrive,
             PID leftEncoder,
             PID rightEncoder,
             PID turningPid)
        Create a new PIDDrivetrain instance
        Parameters:
        leftDrive - the left side drivetrain SpeedController
        rightDrive - the right side drivetrain SpeedController
        leftEncoder - the left side drivetrain Encoder
        rightEncoder - the right side drivetrain Encoder
        turningPid - an AnglePidSrc (eg Gyro) to maintain a straight heading

    • Method Detail

      • defineResources

        protected void defineResources()
        Require the SpeedControllers and PID objects
        Specified by:
        defineResources in class Subsystem

      • turnByDegrees

        public void turnByDegrees(float degrees)
        Turn in place. Positive degrees may be either clockwise or anticlockwise, depending on the setup of your particular AnglePidSrc
        Parameters:
        degrees - how many degrees to turn

      • setTicksTarget

        public void setTicksTarget(int ticks)
        Drive forward a number of encoder ticks.
        Parameters:
        ticks - how many ticks to drive

      • setTask

        public void setTask(PIDDrivetrain.DriveTask t)
        Change the task from driving straight to turning
        Parameters:
        t - the task type to switch to

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Reset the state of the drivetrain to fresh

        Iteratively PID loop.
        Specified by:

      • waitForTarget

        public void waitForTarget()
                   throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Suspends the calling thread until the target is reached, at which point it will be awoken again
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the calling thread is interrupted while waiting
